alert.note: Alert for Lower St. Bernard; Upper Plaquemines (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 2:03PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WEST CENTRAL ST. BERNARD AND NORTHWESTERN PLAQUEMINES PARISHES THROUGH 245 PM CDT... At 202 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout or funnel cloud near Belle Chasse, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Belle Chasse and Poydras. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors or to safe harbor and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
